label: Colombia Records
overview: Dangerously in Love is Beyoncé's debut studio album. This album marked a shift in her career, as she began to move away from Destiny's Child and establish herself as a solo artist. Beyoncé also worked to establish herself as more than just as singer on this album, as she is credited as a co-writer, co-producer, and executive producer. This album contains a variety of mid-tempo and ballad songs that fit into the R&B and soul genre. Though Beyoncé had a hard time gaining support from record executives for this album, it became a huge success, commercially and critically. This is the album that set Beyoncé on the path to becoming the dominating force in the music industry that she is today.

extras.extra1: Dangerously in Love debuted as number one on the US Billdobard 200 chart
extras.extra2: As of June 2016, Dangerously In Love is Beyoncé's best selling album.
extras.extra3: At the 46th Annual Grammy Awards in 2004, Beyoncé won 5 awards for  Dangerously in Love. She won Best Female R&B Vocal Performance, Best R&B Vocal Performance by a Duo or a Group with Vocals, Best R&B Song, Best Contemporary R&B Album, and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration.
extras.extra4: Dangerously in Love is 4x Platinum certified in the United States, and has sold over 5,000,000 units in the United States alone.

label: Colombia Records & Sony Urban
overview: B'Day is Beyoncé's second studio album. It was released on her twenty-fifth birthday on September 4, 2006. This album was completed in only three weeks, and was heavily inspired by Beyoncé's starring role in the musical movie Dreamgirls. This album was postively recieved by critics, and won the Grammary Award for Best Contemporary R&B album in 2007. Beyoncé later released the B'Day Anthology Video Album that included thirteen music videos. The B'Day deluxe album was also released. This album included songs from the original album, as well as various Spanish versions, and remixes.

extras.extra1: B'Day was nominated for five Grammay Awards at the 49th Anual Grammay Awards in 2007. It was nominated for Best Contemporary R&B Album, Best Female R&B Vocal Performance (Ring the Alarm), Best R&B Song (Déjà Vu), Best Rap/Sung Collaboration (Déjà Vu), and Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical (The Freemasons club mix of Déjà Vu).
extras.extra2: In 2008, at the 50th Annual Grammy Awards, B'Day also received nominations for Record of the Year (Irreplaceable) and Best Pop Collaboration With Vocals (Beautiful Liar - Beyoncé and Shakira).
extras.extra3: B'Day was named the 41st best album since 1993 by Vibe Magazine in April 2013
extras.extra4: B'Day was placed on multiple 'Best Albums of the Year' lists from various organizations such as Entertainment Weekly, Spin, Vibe, and Allmusic.

label: Sony Music World & Columbia Records
overview: 'I Am...Sasha Fierce' is Beyoncé's third studio album. This dual disc album was concieved with the intentions of the different sides of Beyoncé's musical talent and artistry. The first disc, 'I Am...', features slow, ballad and R&B songs, while 'Sasha Fierce' features more uptempo, electropop songs. While 'I Am...Sasha Fierce' recieved mixed reviews from critics, it debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, making it Beyoncé's third straight number one debut. It has sold over eight million copies, and was nominated for seven Grammy Awards.'

singles.single2: Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)

extras.extra1: 'I Am...Sasha Fierce' was nominated for seven Grammy Awards at the 52nd Annual Grammy Awards in 2010.  It was nominated for Album of the Year, Record of the Year (Halo), Song of the Year (Single Ladies), Best Female Pop Vocal Performance (Halo), Best Female R&B Vocal Performance (Single Ladies), Best R&B Song (Single Ladies), Best Contemporary R&B Album, and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration (Ego -Beyoncé and Kanye West ). She won every award except Album and Record of the Year.
extras.extra2: In addition to award from the album, Beyoncé won an additional Grammy for her cover of 'At Last'. Her total of six awards broke the record for most wins by a female artist in one night.
extras.extra3: 'I Am...Sasha Fierce' was the tenth best selling album of 2008.
extras.extra4: In 2009, 'I Am...Sasha Fierce' was the second best selling album in the US.

label: Parkwood Entertainment & Columbia Records
overview: '4' is Beyoncé's fourth studio album. After the release of her third album, and world tour, Beyoncé took a hiatus from music in 2010. During this hiatus, she also severed professional ties with her father and manager, who had been mangering her career since her Destiny's Child days. This change resulted in '4', which is an album that was more personal than any of the ones to come before. '4' stepped away from the heavy R&B focused albums of the past and incorporated different styles such as funk, soul, and hip hop.  '4' was recieved positively by critics.

extras.extra1: Love On Top, a single from the album, won Best Traditional R&B Performance Award at the 55th Annual Grammy Awards in 2013.
extras.extra2: At the Billboard Music Awards in 2012, '4' won Best R&B album.
extras.extra3: Once again, '4' debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart. This was Beyoncé's fourth concecutive number one debut.
extras.extra4: '4' was released by Beyoncé's entertainment and management company, Parkwood Entertainment.
